target_population: primarily Black Americans and low-income populations in Alabama, Mississippi, and Louisiana who suffer disproportionately from obesity, diabetes, and hypertension
intervention_approach: multi-level, multi-domain interventions focusing on prevention, treatment, and management of chronic diseases through a precision public health framework
key_objectives: expand the workforce of investigators in translational research
promote bi-directional collaborations between researchers and community partners
advance empirical knowledge through innovative research projects
promote sustainable impact through dissemination of scientific discoveries
methodology: utilizing a collaborative framework that integrates academic and community partners to evaluate interventions across multiple levels of influence and domains
policy_relevance: improving health outcomes in underserved populations
alignment_opportunities: collaboration with NIH on chronic disease research initiatives
engagement in training programs for future biomedical scientists
utilization of real-world data for research and policy development
strategic_recommendations: increase partnerships with local health departments and community organizations
focus on data collection and analysis to support evidence-based interventions
develop training programs for researchers to enhance translational research skills
